snippet: Many of the growth plans laid out in June lack detail and risk being watered down, analysts say.
abstract: Japan's economic boom, spurred on by fiscal plan of Prime Min Shinzo Abe, has moderated amid tepid stock growth; Japanese central bank expects economy to expand 1.5 in 2014, up from previous forecast of 1.3 percent; gains have yet to trickle down to many ordinary Japanese, and analyst warn that lack of detail puts future plans at risk of being watered down.

byline.contributor: Eric Pfanner and Makiko Inoue contributed reporting from Tokyo.

lead_paragraph: Many of the growth plans laid out in June lack detail and risk being watered down, analysts say.

headline.main: After a Run of Growth, Concern Over Japan’s Next Moves
headline.print_headline: After a Run of Growth, Concern Over Japan’s Next Moves
